it.unibo.alchemist.model.interfaces

Interface ITime

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Comparable<ITime>, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DoubleTime

    public interface ITime
extends Comparable<ITime>, Serializable, Cloneable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ITime clone()
      Since the default Java usage for Clonable is cumbersome, this method exists to allow the contruction of copies.
      boolean isInfinite()
      Verifies if the time is set at infinite, namely if the event will never happen.
      ITime multiply(double var)
      Allows to multiply this time for a constant.
      ITime subtract(ITime dt)
      Allows to subtract a time to this time.
      ITime sum(ITime dt)
      Allows to add a time to this time.
      double toDouble()
      Allows to get a double representation of the time.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        ITime clone()
        Since the default Java usage for Clonable is cumbersome, this method exists to allow the contruction of copies.
        Returns:
        a copy of the object. Please notice that it's supposed, given an ITime t, that
        t != t.clone and t.equals(t.clone)
        will be both true.

      • isInfinite

        boolean isInfinite()
        Verifies if the time is set at infinite, namely if the event will never happen.
        Returns:
        true if the time is infinite

      • multiply

        ITime multiply(double var)
        Allows to multiply this time for a constant.
        Parameters:
        var - the time to sum to the current time
        Returns:
        the result of the multiplication

      • subtract

        ITime subtract(ITime dt)
        Allows to subtract a time to this time.
        Parameters:
        dt - the time to subtract from the current time
        Returns:
        the result of the subtraction

      • sum

        ITime sum(ITime dt)
        Allows to add a time to this time.
        Parameters:
        dt - the time to sum to the current time
        Returns:
        the result of the sum

      • toDouble

        double toDouble()
        Allows to get a double representation of the time.
        Returns:
        the double representation of this time
